cluster_relations.rel_desc: Color in branding and design is described as influencing consumer behavior.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (consumer responses, brand perceptions, or brand outcomes).
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Consumer Psychology and Behavior in Branding

cluster_relations.rel_desc: A sense of urgency contributes to or facilitates impulse purchases.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject psychological state or condition contributes to, supports, or facilitates the occurrence of a specific consumer behavior or action.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Color Psychology & Consumer Response in Branding
remarks: Relation inferred from domain logic rather than explicit wording.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Color psychology in branding explains how colors influence consumer brand perceptions.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (consumer responses, brand perceptions, or brand outcomes).
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Consumer Psychology and Behavior in Branding
remarks: Assumes "perceptions" refers specifically to consumer brand perceptions based on entity resolution.
Assumes "perceptions" refers specifically to consumer brand perceptions based on entity resolution.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding or psychological construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (consumer responses, brand perceptions, or brand outcomes).
args.justification: This relation is semantically the same directional causal influence as the other two relations in the chunk (a branding/psychological construct affecting consumer behavior). Normalizing the predicate to the already-used canonical 'influences' with a slightly generalized description improves schema consistency and avoids having a one-off verb variant 'facilitates_consumer_behavior' for the same type of causal link.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject branding or psychological construct exerts a causal or enabling effect on the object (consumer responses, brand perceptions, or brand outcomes).
executed_decisions.justification: This relation is semantically the same directional causal influence as the other two relations in the chunk (a branding/psychological construct affecting consumer behavior). Normalizing the predicate to the already-used canonical 'influences' with a slightly generalized description improves schema consistency and avoids having a one-off verb variant 'facilitates_consumer_behavior' for the same type of causal link.
